A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like:
Plot was riddled with holes that were far too obvious to ignore. The emotional attachments were missing and instead replaced with quick shot action. And for 90% of the film\, I felt like I was watching the director instead of a movie. 
It was the director's work\, his decisions\, his ideology. This movie breaks suspension of disbelief to levels I rarely encounter outside of unpublished\, amateur fantasy novelists\, where I was watching how witty the author was trying to be and how bold they wanted to be rather than being immersed in the characters they were writing about.

Remove Star Wars from the name and remove the hyped fandom reviews. And what you're left with is a mediocre sci-fi flick akin to "Jupitor Ascending".
